After the last little fiasco with my father reading my blogs and finding out that they aren't private, I've decided to create a new account.  It's the last straw and I won't put up with any more of this shit.  I've added some of you already, so if you get a friend request from a name you don't know, im  me and ask me...it's probably me.

For of those you who would still like to be a part of my livejournal world, feel free to add me.

But I've had enough!!

"We went from starting to be friends to a very physical thing and it kind of scares me."
"Yea."

"I want to get to know you better and if having a relationship with you is what it takes, then I will."
"I do want to force anything on you."
"You're not.  Don't worry."

"I meant what I said about everything.  I just want you to know."

I feel this wonderful sense of calm and anticipation now that the whole thing is dealt with.  And it's wonderful.  And great.  And beautiful.  And exciting.  And so many other feelings that just can't be described.

Because it's over, but it's just beginning.  And that is a wonderful feeling to know.

To know that I'm not just a piece of ass.
To know that we can go to Starbucks and just sit there and talk.
To know that he wants to get to know me and that I want to get to know him.

So, even though it's only 2:41 in the afternoon:

Good night my some one, good night...
..True love can be whispered from heart to heart
When lovers are parted they say

"I like hanging out with you...and if we end up dating along the way, I wouldn't mind...Is that cool?"
"Yea."

NO, IT IS NOT COOL.

I want to date you now, not a month from now.  I don't want to share.  I don't want to be worried about if I should feel guilty about flirting with another guy.  I want to know that I should feel guilty about flirting with another guy because I have YOU to flirt with.

That would be cool.

1. How are you feeling about your major today? If it doesn't pan out, what will you do with your life?

You caught me between Hell and a tough spot.  I've been frustrated because I'm being looked at as the great organizer back stage, but I really want to be known as the great character actor on stage.  But then, I just got off the phone with my aunt when I opened this and she's going to put me up for the summer again so that I can work at the Shakespeare Festival in Alabama.  If it doesn't pan out, I'd probably go all the well into Business and then open my own bed and breakfast or bookstore...I might do that anyways...


2. Your inner child is on the loose! What's she doing?

Telling off everyone I hate and kissing the one person that I want to with recklass abandon.  She might also be playing outside without sunscreen and just enjoying life in general...of course, I TRY to do that on a regular basis, so I don't know if it counts...


3. You can't live without...?

Music...it just does something to my stomach and my lungs and my heart that forces words that have a tune to come out.  If I ever became deaf, that would be the worst part, because music is so important to me.


4. What's something you have to do before you die?

That's a hard question for me because there's so many things.  I think the number one thing is to see the world.  I've always felt so trapped and sheltered where I live, that I just want to get out and see things that I've only seen in pictures...


5. What's your biggest fear? WIll you ever get past it?

Failure...I can't stand to fail...and there's no getting past it.  It's not something I can change and as a theatre major, it's going to be the death of me, I can assure you.

Monday morning, I woke up and my throat hurt and my nose was stuffed.  I took Sudafed, popped cough drops, drank a lot of water, and prayed for the best.  

Tuesday morning came and it was no better.  So, I told Denise that I would've loved to have auditioned for the show, but I didn't want to ruin my voice by singing.  But she told me that I could sing on Wedsenday since she had other people doing that as well.  I told her I would see how I was doing the next day.  I went down for the dance audition on Tuesday and thought I did really well.

Wedensday, my throat was better, so I went down at 8:15 with Candice for the callbacks/my audition.  I did the readings, I sang my audition song, I sang the song they gave me and I felt sure confident that I had done the best I could do with what I had and that they could see that my voice was better then it sounded.

And then, during work-study today, Ken got the cast list and says, "Congratulations, A.J."  And my heart just fell to the floor.

WHAT THE HELL AM I DOING HERE???

I'm sitting here, looking at the list of people in the theatre department and looking at who has auditioned for stuff.  And out of everyone, even in the freshmen class, I am the ONLY freshman who hasn't been cast in anything.  Dani and Nathan have at least been in a studio show.  I don't know what I want to do anymore.  I just feel like I'm wasting space in the program and money that I really don't have.  I really don't see a reason for me to be here anymore.  

I don't want to say I'm giving up because there's still studio show auditions next week, but I'm really looking at pulling a Rory next year if things don't perk up.  

Because, really, what's the point if I'm just not getting anything out of it?

Oh.  My.  God.

I will admit that I have a small gulity pleasure of watching "My Sweet 16."  But everytime I watch this show, I am astounded.  I want to jump into my t.v. unit and slap those bitches!  

Now, sometimes they're okay.  There was one girl from Erie who had been adopted and so her sixteenth birthday was her first party.  That was okay.  But the thing that pissed me off was that she failed her permit test and they still got her a car!!!

The one who's on now was pissed because she only got three of the four music stars that she wanted.  

So, that's my little rant about what's really kind of pissing me off...bye bye.

So, last night, I called Ellen to tell her that I finally finished her Christmas gift.  She was going to be in Altoona in the afternoon and she was orginally going to come over to my house and pick it up.  But, then she mentioned bowling, so we (meaning me, her, Adam, Nikki, and Will) all planned to meet at Holiday Bowl.  It took us a while to get there, but we finally did.  

Ellen had called ahead to reserve a lane and she said we were 26 on the list.  But the people were being quite bitchy and by the time it was twenty to ten, we still didn't have a lane.  We had gotten there at about quarter to nine.  So, we decided, they're not worth it, so we left.  We had been talking about going to Hooters afterwards.  So, we drove across the street and went to Hooters.  The boys wanted to see a movie, but since I had to be home by 12, the girls stomped that issue and we went and got a table.  

We had decided that this was the night that we were going to half celebrate my birthday, since we didn't actually do it on my birthday because a) it's right after Christmas and b) I was going out to my dad's since they were putting Toby down.  So, I told them that they could tell the waitress that we were celebrating my birthday.  Then we saw them celebrate someone else's birthday and I began to regret my decision a tiny bit.  But it was cool.  They had me come up front and gave me a hula-hoop and two menus and whenever they pointed to me, I had to hula-hoop (which, by the way, I completely suck at), flap my 'wings' and say "Rah-rah, it's my birthday!"  It was fun.  

But, then, I started thinking while I was watching "CSI" and I was thinking about stuff that they kept saying while we were out, espically to me.  And I noticed that they made a lot of comments about my lack of sexual experience.  

I am proud to be a virgin.

I am proud that I have just about no visual experiences with peni.

No, I didn't lose my virginity when I was a freshman.  No, I haven't date someone for a year and a half and then had sex with me.  I haven't had a "relationship" that has lasted more than about three months.  And that truly doesn't bother me.  Because no one has been worth my time.

Yes, I am the only one of my friends who is not engaged.

Yes, I am the only one of my friends who does not have a boyfriend.

And it doesn't bother me.

BUT BACK THE FUCK OFF OF MY LACK OF EXPERIENCE.

DON'T shove bowling balls in my face or my crotch and pretend they're you're balls.

DON'T send me graphic animations and pictures onto my phone.

I remember how she used to walk me down to kindergarden in the morning and then pick me up in the afternoon.

I remember how, in first grade, on pajama day, she made sure I had an extra set of clothes, just in case we were wrong.

I remember how, whenever she visited us in Virginia, she would also sit outside and smoke and I would sit with her.

I remember when she gave me my Felicity doll for Thanksgiving or Christmas and she had a whole box full of clothes already sewn for her.

I remember how, when I told her that Kirsten's Christmas dress had to be JUST so, she made it JUST so.

I remember how much I loved my Josefina doll when I got it from the "Turkey Man."

I remember how Elliott and I played the Monopoly Jr. game the "Turkey Man" got us pratically all Thanksgiving day the year she got it for us.

I remember how she taught me how to sew on a tablecloth marked with red pen so it was in a straight line.

I remember how she set up a ping pong net on her good dining room table for Elliott and me when we visited.

I remember how she made it to my high school graduation, even though I told her she didn't have to.

I remember how much she loved me and how much I love her.

R.I.P Grammy Doris...I will always love you...

I have a problem.  

I am a compulsive liar.  

Not just to other people, but to myself as well.

Anyone who I care about knows that I have no desire to have children and I have no desire to tie myself down to one man for the rest of my life.

But guess what...

...I'm a compulsive liar.

I do want children.  I want a little girl that I can name after my great-grandmother, Katherine Carol.  And I want a little boy that I can name after my uncle, Daniel Richard.

I do want to tie myself down to one man for the rest of my life.  I want to come home to a family that loves me, that wants me to kiss them, look over their homework, and then tuck them in at night.

I want to go to little league games where they can't hit the ball past the infield.  I want to go to dance recitals where all the little girls and boys suck, but not mine BECAUSE she's mine.

I need to stop lying to myself.  I'm NOT contended to die an old maid.  I'm NOT contended to live without having a child of my own.  I'm NOT contended to never my own wedding.

Why is it that I can never make up my mind?

These past two weeks of class have been just as awesome and wonderful as that first weekend here. 

The Leaderhosen thing that first weekend was fun.  They put names on the back of us and we had to ask other people questions about ourselves to figure out who we were and then find our significant other.  I was Celesiate Flockhart, the chick who played "Ally McBeal" and A.J. was my husband, Harrison Ford...A.J. + me = hotness :-P 

That week of school wasn't too bad.  After Modern Dance, I'm gonna have some killer thighs!!!  Shit, those plies are killing me!!  But, it's fun...I'm enjoying it.  Everything that Mahady is going over so far, I learned in Accounting 1 with Mrs. Fochler.  

I got my yearbook last weekend when I went home.  There's this weird picture of me and Ellen at the senior banquet that looks like we're breaking out in song or something.  It's funny.  There's a picture of me and her at the Homecoming dance that I didn't think would get into the yearbook, but it did, which is cool.  Both Mum and Dad and Amy left me little notes in the yearbook.  Mum's was cuter than Dad's, but they were both the first ones on the pages, so I didn't have to go looking for them.

Tuesday morning, they had potate pancakes in the dining hall for breakfast, so I grabbed a bunch in a bowl and put them in a napkin and Jeanette was like, "Why did you do that?" and I told her so I could take them to class and eat them there since we were running out of time and she was like, "Oh, okay."  So we were doing this thing in Thinking and Writing about current events and she looked over at me and saw me chewing and asked me if I was eating my pancakes.  I nodded and said "I'm a fat girl.  I need my food."  So that's been our thing everysince.  I imed her last night and said "I'm a fat girl...I need my food...what time do you want to fulfill my fat girl needs tomorrow morning?"  Basically, I asked her what time did she want to meet me outside of her dorm to go to breakfast.  Oh vey...

Auditions were on Tuesday for "Mazel" and the Chekhov One-Acts.  Oh vey...so, half-way thorough my monologue, I blanked.  I mean, I could not remember a thing until I actually looked it up.  So, I walked out, walked over to a tree, cried a few tears and then decided to go back in.  I was so pissed at myself.  So, I saw Jeanette was getting to walk out and I told her I would walk back up with her.  When she got outside, she pulled out her cigerettes like she always does and I looked over at her and I was like, "Can I have one, please?"  She stopped and looked at me, like "WHAT???"  I had had a drag of one of hers that first weekend and I told her that I had never smoked before and she gave me one and that was it.  So when I told her I wanted one, she nearly shit herself.  I just said "Just give me a goddamn cigerette, Jeanette." And she was like, "Ok, ok, here..."  We've been joking about it for like, a week now.  That's how pissed off I was at my audition...gah...so then, we watched "Thirteen" in her room, which is a really fucked up movie.  Then we walked over to Havey so she could see J.T. and I went to hang out with A.J. because he always knows how to make me feel better.  He's my comfort.  So, then I read some stuff for acting, went back to my room and forgot about the audition.

So, the next morning, I imed Matt because we knew Karen might have jury duty, so I asked him if we did and he said, no, have you seen the callback list yet?  When I told him no, he told me that I got and I was just like, "Are you shitting me?" But no, after I blanked a minute into my monologue, I still got a callback, so I was all pumped for that.  Went to classes that day, went to my work-study training, then went back to my room to change, and then went to callbacks.  I felt really good about it.  

Then, Matt, Natalie, Daniella, and I got pizza and watched some of "Into the Woods" with Berendette Peters (I HEART HER!!!) It was so funny...Matt said he was too fat to be a Holocaust survivor, which is what "Mazel" is about and then he shoved a spoonful of Marshmallow Fluff into his mouth.  We busted out laughing.

This is the conclusion I've come to about callbacks: they've called me back for two reasons: either they think I'm horrible and they want to laugh at me somemore, in which case, I'm happy to provide a good laugh, or they see potenial in me, in which case, I'm happy to come back...either way, they called me back.

So, Jeanette and I went over to see the cast list this morning with Natalie.  Jeanette got cast in "Mazel" as a survivor (Yea Jeanette), A.J. got cast as understudy for the lead guy, who will be played by an equity actor (BIG YEA!!!!!!!! FOR A.J.).  I was disappointed, but I'm majoring in theatre now, it's not like that's the only chance I'll get to do acting stuff this year.  It's not like high school musicals.  So, then at the book discussion, I saw Terry and I had mentioned to him at the department meeting at his house last week how I would be interested in being a stage manager if he needed one and I wasn't cast.  I guess that stuck, because he told me to talk to Ken about it, who is my production teacher.  So, at Production today, after the discussion, I mentioned it to him about how I would be interested in stage managing and he said he had just sent me an e-mail about it and since I'll be doing it for "Mazel," while "Mazel" is in production, I DON'T HAVE TO GO TO PRODUCTION CLASS!!!!!!!  BIATCHES RIGHT!!!!

I'm so happy, this is going awesome, I LOVE it here!!!

I have a theory about crying.  This theory comes from observing two people cry: myself and my mother.  

I tend be a quiet crier.  You can't really tell I'm crying unless I talk to you or you see it in my face or you hear my sniff.  Most of the times I would blow the sniff off as I had just sneezed or some other excuse like that.  I don't like to have people hear my cry.  I believe I have perfected the quiet cry.  

My mother, on the other hand, cries very loud: bawling, deep inhales, moans, those sort of things.  She goes into her room, slams the door, and you can hear her wail it all out.  

Now the theory comes into play.  

I believe that the way you cry can tell a lot about how you release your emotions.  I tend to keep things inside.  I don't tell people how I'm feeling unless I want a pity party.  Most of the times I do, but I still hold it in.  I rarely find a release for it, unless it is something drastic.  This makes the moments I do cry even worse, because there are WEEKS of pent up tension in them.  Everything comes out.  And I've found that crying doesn't make me feel better, it makes me feel worse.  I feel as though, because no one TRIES to hear my cry, no one cares.  So, in the end, it makes nothing better.

My mother, on the other hand, has been told she is abrasive, which is true.  She does not hide her feelings, she lets them all out.  So when she cries, you know that something deeper is bothering her.  She doesn't want comforted, she just wants to cry.  I don't know if it helps her, but she will go in her room and lie on her bed and cry and probably fall asleep at some point in the middle of it.

Two distinct crying techniquies, two not so distinct personalities.  I am my mother's child of course and, as I've been told time and time again, apples don't fall far from the tree; they truly don't.

So, in conclusion, the way you cry depends on your personality.
